Lenght:79 km Breadth: 1.3-14 km Area: 594 km2 Average depth: 3.0-3.6m

In summer the major towns (Balatonfüred, Keszthely, Siófok, Zamárdi, Balatonboglár) around the lake come alive with colourful programs including a buzzing nightlife. Should you get bored by lieing on the sun or soaking in the silky water you surely will find a concert, a cooking festival or a sport event that will jazz you up.

Badacsony wine region is located in central Transdanubia, on the Northern shores of Lake Balaton, around mount Badacsony. Its area is approximately 1600 hectares.The climate is mild, tempered with relatively high air humidity. Due to the proximity of Lake Balaton the Southern slopes receive the sun light reflected from the lake is surface. The reflection of the sunshine makes that the micro-climate is ideal for grape cultivation. Szürkebarát is one of the best known varieties cultivated in the Badacsony wine region.

Keszthely located on the western shore of Lake Balaton. The largest city by the lake and one of the more important cultural, educational and economic hubs in the region. Due to its favorable location Keszthely and the surrounding area is a preferred holiday destination."

Héviz. The town is located near Lake Hévíz, the worlds second-largest thermal lake, but biologically the biggest active natural lake. Its temperature is affected by the combination of hot and cold spring waters, coming from 38 meters underground. The water breaks out from a spring cave, at approximately 410 liters per second, with a temperature of 40 °C (104 °F).

Tihany is a village on the northern shore of Lake Balaton on the Tihany Peninsula The whole peninsula is a historical district. Tihany is the most spectacular place of the lake Balaton. The peninsula is deeply elongating in to the Balaton, offering a very special view from every point. Tihanys fame is based on its natural and historical sights.

Siófok is a city in Hungary on the southern bank of Lake Balaton in Somogy County. The city is one of Hungarys most popular holiday destinations, famous for its beaches and nightlife. Siófok is one of the richest municipalities of Hungary due to tourism. Hungarians often call the town The capital of Balaton, as it is the largest city on its shores and acts as the commercial and touristic hub of the region.

You can approach the two-towered Benedictine Abbey, symbol of Tihany, on a steep winding road by walk or by bycicle.Beautiful frescos adorn the interior of the abbey built in the first half of the 18th century. The churchs organ is from 1764 but it was destroyed by a granade in 1945.The abbey hosts classical music concerts throughout the year.

Echo used to be Tihany is most noted phenomena that every tourist to the pensinsula tried over and over again from the Visszhang (Echo) Hill. The walls of the Abbey rever berated words shouted from the top of the hill, however the phenomena is disapearing due to increased noise and other buildings built over the years.

On the northern part of the Tihany peninsula you can see Central Europes only remained hermit colony created by Greek monks whom King Andrew I. invited to Hungary. You can see some of the cells and a cave-church carved out by th emonks. Some of the cave hosues are at 20 m high.

The Festetics Palace is a Baroque palace located in the town of Keszthely, Zala, Hungary The palace has housed an independent museum (Helikon Palace Museum) since 1974; it is visited by 200,000 people each year.

The annual Lavender Festival in co-production of the Németh László Culture Centre and the Balaton-felvidéki National Park is a location-specific event focusing on lavender, which has always played an important role in the life of Tihany.
The Motion Picture Theatre has a projection room for 104 people, which was renovated in 2005. Recently new digital technology equipment has been installed ensuring up-to-date video and sound quality.
Balaton Sound is the center of summer parties and concerts organised by the Coca Cola beach.
Balatons beautiful waters provide various fishing adventures for you almost all year round. Look for carps near the reeds in clear, flat water with rolling vine-lands in the background.
In winter when temperature falls well be low zero for many days the frozen lake attract ice skaters and a new winter sport craze, ice sailing is also becoming more and more popular.
Whether you want to learn windsurfing, go for sailing, or just admiring the picturesque scenery at sunset from a boat you can find an opportunity to do so at Lake Balaton.
You can explore the lake-side settlement son one of the best cycle paths in the country, with total length of approx. 200 km.
